pl_output:
dark.wrapper is used to create libraries. its arguments are:

  `Na`: arguments from the calling script
  `Nc`: context from the calling script
  `Nd`: documentation to return when called via the CLI
  `Nf`: array of functions to create the library

the library starts as the empty object. for each function, the function is
called on the library alongside the passed arguments, then the return value's
enumerable properties are added to the object. if a library ends up being
loaded multiple times, the arguments get merged into a single object. this is
only useful if the arguments are accessed when methods are called, as the
library is initialised eagerly

for convenience, the "scripts" argument to libraries accepts an array of
scriptors which expands out to properties for each script name, with the period
removed. there are a few known scripts which get expanded to shorter aliases,
namely:

  accts.balance -> ab
  accts.transactions -> at
  accts.xfer_gc_to -> ax
  chats.tell -> ct
  market.browse -> mbr
  market.buy -> mby
  market.sell -> ms
  owo.notices_ur_loc -> owo
  sys.access_log -> sa
  sys.manage -> sm
  sys.upgrades -> su
  your.bank -> bank

if any of the known scriptors is accessed but not provided via the CLI, a
friendly error will be returned so that the user knows what's wrong.
